catalog_metadata.name: ICP cluster on Amazon EC2
catalog_metadata.description: Deploy an ICP 3.2.1 cluster on Amazon EC2, loads the MCM 3.2.1 docker images and deploys the MCM Klusterlet to make this a managed cluster.
catalog_metadata.longDescription: Deploy an ICP 3.2.1 cluster on Amazon EC2, loads the MCM 3.2.1 docker images and deploys the MCM Klusterlet to make this a managed cluster.
catalog_metadata.author: admin

tags.name: Request_Group
tags.label: Request_Group
tags.description: The current context group id of the current user that requested the provisioning of the template. This is important because a user may be part of more than one group and this identifies the context of which group the user made the request.

tags.name: Request_User
tags.label: Request_User
tags.description: The user id of the current user that requested the provisioning of the template.

tags.name: Service_Name
tags.label: Service_Name
tags.description: Name provided for the service instance by the end user at time of request

tags.name: Service_Identifier
tags.label: Service_Identifier
tags.description: Unique identifer generated by ICAM which is mapped to the service instance of the template provisioned.

actions.name: Provision
actions.description: Default action for deployment of service

input_parameters.name: mcm_controller
input_parameters.label: IBM MCM Controller Definition
input_parameters.description: IBM MCM Controller (hub cluster) details will be used to import a managed cluster to the controller.

input_parameters.name: aws_region
input_parameters.label: AWS Region
input_parameters.description: AWS region to deploy your ICP cluster nodes. For an HA installation, the AWS selected region should have at least 3 availability zones.

input_parameters.name: aws_azs
input_parameters.label: Availability Zones
input_parameters.description: The availability zone letter identifier in the above selected region. For high availability should have at least 3 availability zones. Setting to a single availability zone will disable high availability and not provision EFS, in this case, reduce the number of master and proxy nodes to 1. If you are installing this service from ICP Catalog, your input should look like ["a", "b"]

input_parameters.name: aws_key_name
input_parameters.label: Key Name
input_parameters.description: Name of the EC2 key pair.

input_parameters.name: aws_privatekey
input_parameters.label: Private Key
input_parameters.description: Base64 encoded private key file contents of the EC2 key pair.
input_parameters.regexdesc: Enter a valid base64 encoded text. Base64 encoded text contains alphanumeric characters and equals symbol as padding.

input_parameters.name: aws_vpcname
input_parameters.label: VPC Name
input_parameters.description: AWS VPC Name prefix. This value is used to prefix the VPC created for ICP nodes.

input_parameters.name: aws_cidr
input_parameters.label: VPC CIDR block
input_parameters.description: AWS VPC CIDR block. This is the primary CIDR block for your ICP node VPC.

input_parameters.name: aws_subnetname
input_parameters.label: Subnet Name
input_parameters.description: Subnet name prefix for public and private subnets used by ICP nodes.

input_parameters.name: aws_subnet_cidrs
input_parameters.label: Private Subnet CIDRs
input_parameters.description: List of subnet CIDRs. Total number of CIDR entry must match the number of availability zone provided above. A CIDR value is used in the creation of a private subnet in an availability zone for the worker nodes. If you are installing this service from ICP Catalog, your input should look like ["10.10.10.0/24", "10.10.11.0/24"]

input_parameters.name: aws_pub_subnet_cidrs
input_parameters.label: Public Subnet CIDRs
input_parameters.description: List of subnet CIDRs. Total number of CIDR entry must match the number of availability zone provided above. A CIDR value is used in the creation of a public subnet in an availability zone for the proxy and management nodes. If you are installing this service from ICP Catalog, your input should look like ["10.10.20.0/24", "10.10.21.0/24"]

input_parameters.name: aws_private_domain
input_parameters.label: Private Domain
input_parameters.description: Private domain name that is used to create route53 name.

input_parameters.name: aws_ami
input_parameters.label: Amazon Machine Image (AMI-ID)
input_parameters.description: Default Amazon Machine Image ID that will be used if AMI ID for individual node is not provided.

input_parameters.name: icp_bastion
input_parameters.label: Bastion Node
input_parameters.description: Bastion host that you can use to ssh into ICP cluster nodes. Can be used for debugging purpose.

input_parameters.name: icp_master
input_parameters.label: Master Node
input_parameters.description: Master node details. Each master node will be created in a different AZS. Number of AZS, public subnet and private subnet must match the number of master node.

input_parameters.name: icp_proxy
input_parameters.label: Proxy Node
input_parameters.description: Proxy node details. Each proxy node will be created in a different AZS. Number of AZS, public subnet and private subnet must match the number of proxy node.

input_parameters.name: icp_management
input_parameters.label: Management Node
input_parameters.description: Management node details. Each management node will be created in a different AZS. Number of AZS, public subnet and private subnet must match the number of management node.

input_parameters.name: icp_worker
input_parameters.label: Worker Node
input_parameters.description: Worker node details. Each worker node will be created in a different AZS. Number of AZS, public subnet and private subnet must match the number of worker node.

input_parameters.name: icp_va
input_parameters.label: Vulnerability Advisor Node
input_parameters.description: Vulnerability Advisor node details. Each VA node will be created in a different AZS. Number of AZS, public subnet and private subnet must match the number of VA node.

input_parameters.name: icp_instance_name
input_parameters.label: Cluster Name
input_parameters.description: ICP Cluster Name
input_parameters.regexdesc: Cluster name can have lower case alphabets, numbers and dash. Must start with lower case alphabet and end with alpha-numeric character. Maximum length is 63 characters.

input_parameters.name: icp_password
input_parameters.label: ICP Password
input_parameters.description: ICP user password
input_parameters.regexdesc: Password can have lower and upper case alphabets, numbers and dash. Minimum length must be eight characters.

input_parameters.name: icp_docker_package_location
input_parameters.label: Docker Package Location
input_parameters.description: Docker package location is required when installing ICP EE on RedHat. Prefix the location string with protocol. Example s3://, http:// or nfs://.

input_parameters.name: icp_image_location
input_parameters.label: ICP EE Image Location
input_parameters.description: Image location of ICP EE. Prefix the location string with protocol Example: s3://, http:// or nfs://.

input_parameters.name: icp_inception_image
input_parameters.label: ICP Inception Image
input_parameters.description: Name of the bootstrap installation image.
